00041 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LLITE

00045 # include <linux/uidgid.h>

00053 /*****************************************************************************
00054  *
00055  * Object operations.
00056  *
00057  */
00058 
00059 int vvp_object_invariant(const struct cl_object *obj)
00060 {
00061         struct inode            *inode  = vvp_object_inode(obj);
00062         struct ll_inode_info    *lli    = ll_i2info(inode);
00063 
00064         return (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) || inode->i_mode == 0) &&
00065                lli->lli_clob == obj;
00066 }
00067 
00068 static int vvp_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00069                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o)
00070 {
00071         struct vvp_object    *obj   = lu2vvp(o);
00072         struct inode         *inode = obj->vob_inode;
00073         struct ll_inode_info *lli;
00074 
00075         (*p)(env, cookie, "(%d %d) inode: %p ",
00076              atomic_read(&obj->vob_transient_pages),
00077              atomic_read(&obj->vob_mmap_cnt),
00078              inode);
00079         if (inode) {
00080                 lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00081                 (*p)(env, cookie, "%lu/%u %o %u %d %p "DFID,
00082                      inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation, inode->i_mode,
00083                      inode->i_nlink, atomic_read(&inode->i_count),
00084                      lli->lli_clob, PFID(&lli->lli_fid));
00085         }
00086         return 0;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static int vvp_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00090                         struct cl_attr *attr)
00091 {
00092         struct inode *inode = vvp_object_inode(obj);
00093 
00094         /*
00095          * lov overwrites most of these fields in
00096          * lov_attr_get()->...lov_merge_lvb_kms(), except when inode
00097          * attributes are newer.
00098          */
00099 
00100         attr->cat_size = i_size_read(inode);
00101         attr->cat_mtime = LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime);
00102         attr->cat_atime = LTIME_S(inode->i_atime);
00103         attr->cat_ctime = LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime);
00104         attr->cat_blocks = inode->i_blocks;
00105         attr->cat_uid = from_kuid(&init_user_ns, inode->i_uid);
00106         attr->cat_gid = from_kgid(&init_user_ns, inode->i_gid);
00107         /* KMS is not known by this layer */
00108         return 0; /* layers below have to fill in the rest */
00109 }
00110 
00111 static int vvp_attr_update(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00112                            const struct cl_attr *attr, unsigned valid)
00113 {
00114         struct inode *inode = vvp_object_inode(obj);
00115 
00116         if (valid & CAT_UID)
00117                 inode->i_uid = make_kuid(&init_user_ns, attr->cat_uid);
00118         if (valid & CAT_GID)
00119                 inode->i_gid = make_kgid(&init_user_ns, attr->cat_gid);
00120         if (valid & CAT_ATIME)
00121                 LTIME_S(inode->i_atime) = attr->cat_atime;
00122         if (valid & CAT_MTIME)
00123                 LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime) = attr->cat_mtime;
00124         if (valid & CAT_CTIME)
00125                 LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime) = attr->cat_ctime;
00126         if (0 && valid & CAT_SIZE)
00127                 i_size_write(inode, attr->cat_size);
00128         /* not currently necessary */
00129         if (0 && valid & (CAT_UID|CAT_GID|CAT_SIZE))
00130                 mark_inode_dirty(inode);
00131         return 0;
00132 }
00133 
00134 static int vvp_conf_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00135                         const struct cl_object_conf *conf)
00136 {
00137         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(conf->coc_inode);
00138 
00139         if (conf->coc_opc == OBJECT_CONF_INVALIDATE) {
00140                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, DFID ": losing layout lock\n",
00141                        PFID(&lli->lli_fid));
00142 
00143                 ll_layout_version_set(lli, CL_LAYOUT_GEN_NONE);
00144 
00145                 /* Clean up page mmap for this inode.
00146                  * The reason for us to do this is that if the page has
00147                  * already been installed into memory space, the process
00148                  * can access it without interacting with lustre, so this
00149                  * page may be stale due to layout change, and the process
00150                  * will never be notified.
00151                  * This operation is expensive but mmap processes have to pay
00152                  * a price themselves. */
00153                 unmap_mapping_range(conf->coc_inode->i_mapping,
00154                                     0, OBD_OBJECT_EOF, 0);
00155         }
00156         return 0;
00157 }
00158 
00159 static int vvp_prune(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj)
00160 {
00161         struct inode *inode = vvp_object_inode(obj);
00162         int rc;
00163         ENTRY;
00164 
00165         rc = cl_sync_file_range(inode, 0, OBD_OBJECT_EOF, CL_FSYNC_LOCAL, 1);
00166         if (rc < 0) {
00167                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, DFID ": writeback failed: %d\n",
00168                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->co_lu)), rc);
00169                 RETURN(rc);
00170         }
00171 
00172         truncate_inode_pages(inode->i_mapping, 0);
00173         RETURN(0);
00174 }
00175 
00176 static int vvp_object_glimpse(const struct lu_env *env,
00177                               const struct cl_object *obj, struct ost_lvb *lvb)
00178 {
00179         struct inode *inode = vvp_object_inode(obj);
00180 
00181         ENTRY;
00182         lvb->lvb_mtime = LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime);
00183         lvb->lvb_atime = LTIME_S(inode->i_atime);
00184         lvb->lvb_ctime = LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime);
00185 
00186         /*
00187          * LU-417: Add dirty pages block count lest i_blocks reports 0, some
00188          * "cp" or "tar" on remote node may think it's a completely sparse file
00189          * and skip it.
00190          */
00191         if (lvb->lvb_size > 0 && lvb->lvb_blocks == 0)
00192                 lvb->lvb_blocks = dirty_cnt(inode);
00193 
00194         RETURN(0);
00195 }
00196 
00197 static void vvp_req_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00198                              struct cl_req_attr *attr)
00199 {
00200         struct inode *inode;
00201         struct obdo  *oa;
00202         u64 valid_flags = OBD_MD_FLTYPE;
00203 
00204         oa = attr->cra_oa;
00205         inode = vvp_object_inode(obj);
00206 
00207         if (attr->cra_type == CRT_WRITE)
00208                 valid_flags |= OBD_MD_FLMTIME | OBD_MD_FLCTIME |
00209                                OBD_MD_FLUID | OBD_MD_FLGID;
00210         obdo_from_inode(oa, inode, valid_flags & attr->cra_flags);
00211         obdo_set_parent_fid(oa, &ll_i2info(inode)->lli_fid);
00212         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_INVALID_PFID))
00213                 oa->o_parent_oid++;
00214         memcpy(attr->cra_jobid, ll_i2info(inode)->lli_jobid, LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE);
00215 }
00216 
00217 static const struct cl_object_operations vvp_ops = {
00218         .coo_page_init    = vvp_page_init,
00219         .coo_lock_init    = vvp_lock_init,
00220         .coo_io_init      = vvp_io_init,
00221         .coo_attr_get     = vvp_attr_get,
00222         .coo_attr_update  = vvp_attr_update,
00223         .coo_conf_set     = vvp_conf_set,
00224         .coo_prune        = vvp_prune,
00225         .coo_glimpse      = vvp_object_glimpse,
00226         .coo_req_attr_set = vvp_req_attr_set
00227 };
00228 
00229 static int vvp_object_init0(const struct lu_env *env,
00230                             struct vvp_object *vob,
00231                             const struct cl_object_conf *conf)
00232 {
00233         vob->vob_inode = conf->coc_inode;
00234         atomic_set(&vob->vob_transient_pages, 0);
00235         cl_object_page_init(&vob->vob_cl, sizeof(struct vvp_page));
00236         return 0;
00237 }
00238 
00239 static int vvp_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *obj,
00240                            const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00241 {
00242         struct vvp_device *dev = lu2vvp_dev(obj->lo_dev);
00243         struct vvp_object *vob = lu2vvp(obj);
00244         struct lu_object  *below;
00245         struct lu_device  *under;
00246         int result;
00247 
00248         under = &dev->vdv_next->cd_lu_dev;
00249         below = under->ld_ops->ldo_object_alloc(env, obj->lo_header, under);
00250         if (below != NULL) {
00251                 const struct cl_object_conf *cconf;
00252 
00253                 cconf = lu2cl_conf(conf);
00254                 lu_object_add(obj, below);
00255                 result = vvp_object_init0(env, vob, cconf);
00256         } else
00257                 result = -ENOMEM;
00258 
00259         return result;
00260 }
00261 
00262 static void vvp_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *obj)
00263 {
00264         struct vvp_object *vob = lu2vvp(obj);
00265 
00266         lu_object_fini(obj);
00267         lu_object_header_fini(obj->lo_header);
00268         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(vob, vvp_object_kmem);
00269 }
00270 
00271 static const struct lu_object_operations vvp_lu_obj_ops = {
00272         .loo_object_init        = vvp_object_init,
00273         .loo_object_free        = vvp_object_free,
00274         .loo_object_print       = vvp_object_print,
00275 };
00276 
00277 struct vvp_object *cl_inode2vvp(struct inode *inode)
00278 {
00279         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00280         struct cl_object     *obj = lli->lli_clob;
00281         struct lu_object     *lu;
00282 
00283         LASSERT(obj != NULL);
00284         lu = lu_object_locate(obj->co_lu.lo_header, &vvp_device_type);
00285         LASSERT(lu != NULL);
00286 
00287         return lu2vvp(lu);
00288 }
00289 
00290 struct lu_object *vvp_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00291                                    const struct lu_object_header *unused,
00292                                    struct lu_device *dev)
00293 {
00294         struct vvp_object *vob;
00295         struct lu_object  *obj;
00296 
00297         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(vob, vvp_object_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00298         if (vob != NULL) {
00299                 struct cl_object_header *hdr;
00300 
00301                 obj = &vob->vob_cl.co_lu;
00302                 hdr = &vob->vob_header;
00303                 cl_object_header_init(hdr);
00304                 hdr->coh_page_bufsize = cfs_size_round(sizeof(struct cl_page));
00305 
00306                 lu_object_init(obj, &hdr->coh_lu, dev);
00307                 lu_object_add_top(&hdr->coh_lu, obj);
00308 
00309                 vob->vob_cl.co_ops = &vvp_ops;
00310                 obj->lo_ops = &vvp_lu_obj_ops;
00311         } else
00312                 obj = NULL;
00313         return obj;
00314 }
